p: Chamazulene has a variety of pharmacological activities, such as an anti-inflammatory and antioxidant [ 46, 47]. Its insecticide activity was also proven in our earlier study, which had contact activity against Stegobium paniceum and Tribolium castaneum (LD 50 = 4.30 and 29.52 Âµg/adult), respectively [ 45]. Its fumigant, contact, and repellent effects against the cigarette beetle are found for the first time. Furthermore, chamazulene is a characteristic composition from German chamomile and some chemotypes of yarrow [ 46]. However, there were few records about this compound in Artemisia in China. Here, the chamazulene accounts for over 40% of the essential oil, which suggests A. lavandulaefolia is a valuable plant resource.
